segments.en: Welcome to another great lesson with us here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到EnglishPod的又一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: And today we're going to be talking about an ER, an emergency room.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论急救室。

segments.en: We're bringing you our very own ER drama here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 我们在EnglishPod为您带来我们自己的急救剧。

segments.en: Yeah, doctor shows are very popular with people, medical terms and all that stuff.
segments.cn: 是的，医生节目在大家中非常受欢迎，医学术语等等。

segments.en: Yeah, so we're going to teach you some words that you might hear commonly in medical shows, on TV or in movies.
segments.cn: 是的，所以我们将教你一些在医疗节目、电视或电影中常听到的词汇。

segments.en: This is really common language in television.
segments.cn: 这在电视中是非常常见的语言。

segments.en: Or even at a hospital, right?
But let's hope our listeners don't have to face this.
segments.cn: 但希望我们的听众不必面对这些。

segments.en: Okay, so let's preview some words in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们预览一些词汇。

segments.en: Alright, so what's our first word?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们的第一个词是什么？

segments.en: Okay, the first word is CPR.
Well, it's short for cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
If that means anything to you.
segments.cn: 如果这对你有意义的话。

segments.en: Well, cardio is related to the heart.
Resuscitation means to come back to life.
Yes, so basically CPR is, you know when someone stops breathing, you put your mouth on their mouth and you breathe inside their lungs.
segments.cn: 是的，基本上CPR是，当某人停止呼吸时，你把嘴放在他们的嘴上，给他们的肺部输送空气。

segments.en: Okay, so let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: So BP is short for... Blood pressure.
That's just the way that doctors use it in the emergency room.
segments.cn: 这就是医生在急救室中使用的方式。
还有我们的最后一个词。

segments.en: Basically, it's really serious that you stop breathing.
segments.cn: 基本上，停止呼吸是非常严重的。

segments.en: Okay, so if you go into acute respiratory failure, then the doctor or somebody has to perform CPR.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你进入急性呼吸衰竭，那么医生或其他人必须进行CPR。

segments.en: Okay, so we've previewed these three great words.
segments.cn: 好的，我们已经预览了这三个很棒的词。

segments.en: Now let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 现在让我们第一次听对话。

segments.en: It's going to be really fast and you're going to have a lot of drama in it, so don't worry if you don't understand everything.
segments.cn: 这会很快，你会看到很多戏剧，所以如果你不理解所有内容也不要担心。

segments.en: Yeah, we're going to come back and teach you some of the important language.
segments.cn: 是的，我们会回来教你一些重要的语言。

segments.en: My poor little Frankie, just stop breathing.
segments.cn: 我可怜的小Frankie，停止呼吸了。

segments.en: I tried to perform CPR, but I just, I don't know if I could get any air into his lungs.
segments.cn: 我试着进行CPR，但我不知道能否给他的肺部输送空气。

segments.en: Ellen, get him hooked up to a monitor.
Get the patient to hold still.
No, Frankie, that did this for me.
Someone get her out of here.
Come on, dammit, I'm not letting go of you.
segments.cn: 来吧，见鬼，我不会放开你。

segments.en: Patient is in acute respiratory failure.
segments.cn: 病人处于急性呼吸衰竭中。

segments.en: I think we're going to have to intubate.
All right, tube's in, bag him.
segments.cn: 好吧，管子插入了，给他通气。

segments.en: Somebody give him 10 cc's shot of adrenaline.
segments.cn: 有人给他10cc的肾上腺素注射。
快点，大家，动起来，动起来。

segments.en: Doctor, oh thank god, how is he?
segments.cn: 医生，哦，感谢上帝，他怎么样？

segments.en: We've managed to stabilize Frankie, but he's not out of the woods yet.
segments.cn: 我们已经成功稳定了Frankie，但他还没有脱离危险。

segments.en: We're moving him to intensive care, but... Doctor, just do whatever it takes.
segments.cn: 我们正在将他转移到重症监护室，但... 医生，尽一切可能。

segments.en: I just want my little Frankie to be okay.
I couldn't imagine life without my little hamster.
segments.cn: 我无法想象没有我的小仓鼠的生活。

segments.en: Wow, so much drama over a little hamster.
segments.cn: 哇，为了一个小仓鼠有这么多戏剧。

segments.en: A little pet, the little hamster.
Well, you know what, I can relate to this owner, and I'm going to tell you a little bit more about that later.
segments.cn: 嗯，你知道，我能理解这个主人，我稍后会告诉你更多。

segments.en: Yeah, I know you have a really good story about this.
segments.cn: 是的，我知道你有一个很好的故事。

segments.en: Yeah, but in the meantime, let's look at some great language in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 是的，但在此期间，让我们看看语言要点中的一些好语言。

segments.en: All right, so let's take a look at our first word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看我们的第一个词。

segments.en: So this is a medical procedure.
When a patient can't breathe properly, sometimes the doctor takes a long tube and puts it into their mouth and down their pipes, I guess, down their breathing tube.
segments.cn: 当病人无法正常呼吸时，医生有时会用一根长管子放入他们的嘴里，深入气管。

segments.en: So that they can breathe better.
segments.cn: 这样他们就能更好地呼吸。

segments.en: Okay, so once they've intubated the patient, they start to bag him.
segments.cn: 一旦他们插管了病人，就开始给他通气。

segments.en: Does that mean they like put a bag over the person's head or something?
segments.cn: 这是不是意味着他们把一个袋子放在病人的头上？

segments.en: So there's a bag attached to this intubation tube, and you squeeze it to put air into the lungs.
segments.cn: 其实是有一个袋子连接在插管管子上，你挤压它把空气送入肺部。

segments.en: Okay, so you squeeze this bag and it puts air through the tube.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你挤压这个袋子，它通过管子送空气。

segments.en: I think this is just medical slang.
segments.cn: 我觉得这只是医疗行话。

segments.en: Yeah, but you hear it all the time on TV, so it's important our listeners know it.
segments.cn: 是的，但你在电视上经常听到，所以让我们的听众知道很重要。

segments.en: Okay, let's look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个单词。
这种状态意味着很严重。

segments.en: Right, if a patient is in critical condition, they're either really, really hurt or really, really sick and they could die pretty soon.
segments.cn: 对，如果病人处于危重状态，他们要么受了重伤，要么生病得很严重，可能很快就会死。

segments.en: Okay, so you don't want to be in critical condition.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你不想处于危重状态。

segments.en: Let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: So when the doctor stabilize a patient, they take that patient out of danger.
segments.cn: 所以当医生稳定病人时，他们把病人从危险中救出来。

segments.en: Exactly, when a patient is stabilized, they probably won't die in five minutes.
segments.cn: 正是如此，当病人稳定时，他们可能在五分钟内不会死。

segments.en: But they could still be really sick, they could be in critical condition, right?
segments.cn: 但他们可能仍然很病重，可能处于危重状态，对吗？

segments.en: Let's look at our last word.
segments.cn: 让我们看看最后一个单词。

segments.en: So that's the place where patients who are in critical condition are taken.
segments.cn: 所以这是危重病人被送去的地方。

segments.en: So what's the difference between an ICU and a regular room?
segments.cn: 那么ICU和普通病房有什么区别？

segments.en: Well, I don't know, I've never been in one.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道，我从来没有去过。

segments.en: But I think like patients are monitored regularly and I think there's, you know, maybe more, maybe there are more nurses and fewer patients.
segments.cn: 但我想病人会定期被监测，可能会有更多的护士，病人会更少。

segments.en: There's just a higher level of care.
Okay, so it's time for us to listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好的，现在是时候再听一遍我们的对话了。

segments.en: Now try to catch all of these medical terms that we've just talked about, and then we'll come back and explain a few phrases.
segments.cn: 现在试着捕捉我们刚刚讨论的所有医疗术语，然后我们会回来解释一些短语。

segments.en: My poor little Frankie has just stopped breathing.
segments.cn: 我可怜的小弗兰基刚刚停止呼吸。

segments.en: I tried to perform CPR, but I just, I don't know if I could get any air into his lungs.
segments.cn: 我试着进行心肺复苏，但我不知道能否给他的肺里输送空气。

segments.en: Ellen, get him hooked up to a monitor.
segments.cn: 艾伦，把他连接到监护仪上。

segments.en: Get the patient to hold still.
Someone get her out of here!
Come on, dammit, I'm not letting go of you.
segments.cn: 来吧，见鬼，我不会放开你。

segments.en: The patient is in acute respiratory failure.
segments.cn: 病人处于急性呼吸衰竭。

segments.en: I think we're going to have to intubate.
Somebody give him 10 cc's shot of adrenaline.
segments.cn: 有人给他注射10cc肾上腺素。

segments.en: We've managed to stabilize Frankie, but he's not out of the woods yet.
segments.cn: 我们已经成功稳定了弗兰基，但他还没有脱离危险。

segments.en: We're moving him to intensive care, but... Doctor, just do whatever it takes.
segments.cn: 我们正在将他转移到重症监护室，但……医生，尽一切可能。

segments.en: I just want my little Frankie to be okay.
segments.cn: 我只希望我的小弗兰基没事。

segments.en: I couldn't imagine life without my little hamster.
segments.cn: 我无法想象没有我的小仓鼠的生活。

segments.en: Okay, so there are some really good phrasal verbs in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，这段对话中有一些非常好的短语动词。

segments.en: Yeah, a couple of good phrasal verbs.
segments.cn: 是的，有几个好的短语动词。

segments.en: Okay, so let's take a look at these phrasal verbs in putting it together.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看这些短语动词是如何组合在一起的。

segments.en: All right, so what's our first phrasal verb today?
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们的第一个短语动词是什么？

segments.en: So when we talk about hooking something up, we are usually talking about electronics, right Marco?
segments.cn: 当我们谈论连接某物时，通常是在谈论电子产品，对吧，马尔科？

segments.en: Yeah, you usually hook up your TV or your computer.
segments.cn: 是的，你通常会连接你的电视或电脑。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to some examples of how we would use hook up.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不听一些关于如何使用连接的例子呢。

segments.en: I finally got a Nintendo Wii!
segments.cn: 我终于得到了一个任天堂Wii！

segments.en: Come on, help me hook it up to the TV.
segments.cn: 来吧，帮我把它连接到电视上。

segments.en: I don't know how to hook up this new DVD player.
segments.cn: 我不知道如何连接这个新的DVD播放器。

segments.en: I just hooked up my new HDTV.
segments.cn: 我刚刚连接了我的新高清电视。

segments.en: Want to come over and watch a movie?
Great, so you can see that there are a few different variations of this pattern here with the word hook up because it's a phrasal verb.
segments.cn: 很好，所以你可以看到这里有几种不同的变体，因为“连接”是一个短语动词。

segments.en: And I think the same patterns can apply to our next phrasal verb.
segments.cn: 我认为同样的模式可以应用于我们的下一个短语动词。

segments.en: So the doctor needed the patient to hold still.
segments.cn: 所以医生需要病人保持静止。

segments.en: Let's listen to some more examples of hold still because again, it's a really great phrasal verb that you can change up a little bit.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些关于保持静止的例子，因为这也是一个很好的短语动词，可以稍微变化一下。

segments.en: If you don't hold still, I can't see if you have something in your eye.
segments.cn: 如果你不保持静止，我就看不出你眼里是否有东西。

segments.en: Hold still while she cuts your hair or else she might make a mistake.
segments.cn: 在她剪你的头发时保持静止，否则她可能会犯错。

segments.en: Alright, one final phrase for you.
segments.cn: 好吧，最后一个短语给你。

segments.en: So when someone's out of the woods, they're... Free from danger.
segments.cn: 所以当某人脱离危险时，他们……

segments.en: I guess it's kind of a saying.
I guess there are two variants of this phrase.
segments.cn: 我想这个短语有两个变体。

segments.en: We can say, I'm out of the woods, or we're out of the woods, or I guess we're not out of the woods yet.
segments.cn: 我们可以说，我脱离危险了，或者我们脱离危险了，或者我想我们还没有脱离危险。

segments.en: Okay, so now it's time for us to listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是时候再次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And when we come back, Eric is going to tell us about her ER story.
segments.cn: 当我们回来时，埃里克将告诉我们她的急诊室故事。

segments.en: My poor little Frankie has just stopped breathing.
segments.cn: 我可怜的小弗兰基刚刚停止呼吸。

segments.en: I tried to perform CPR, but I just... I don't know if I could get any air into his lungs.
segments.cn: 我试着进行心肺复苏，但我……我不知道是否能给他的肺里输送空气。

segments.en: Ellen, get him hooked up to a monitor.
segments.cn: 艾伦，把他连接到监护仪上。

segments.en: Get the patient to hold still.
Someone get her out of here!
Come on, dammit, I'm not letting go of you.
segments.cn: 来吧，见鬼，我不会放开你。

segments.en: Patient is in acute respiratory failure.
segments.cn: 病人处于急性呼吸衰竭。

segments.en: I think we're going to have to intubate.
Somebody give him 10 cc's shot of adrenaline.
segments.cn: 有人给他10cc的肾上腺素注射。
快点，人们，动起来，动起来！

segments.en: We've managed to stabilize Frankie, but he's not out of the woods yet.
segments.cn: 我们已经成功稳定了弗兰基，但他还没有脱离危险。

segments.en: We're moving him to intensive care, but... Doctor, just do whatever it takes.
segments.cn: 我们正在将他转移到重症监护室，但……医生，尽一切可能。

segments.en: I just want my little Frankie to be okay.
segments.cn: 我只希望我的小弗兰基没事。

segments.en: I couldn't imagine life without my little hamster.
segments.cn: 我无法想象没有我的小仓鼠的生活。
好吧，埃里卡，发生了什么？
你遇到了什么紧急情况？

segments.en: Well, it was with my cat.
Yes, I had some people over for dinner.
segments.cn: 是的，我请了一些人来吃晚饭。

segments.en: And it was maybe 1.30 in the morning.
And I went downstairs to let them out and show them where the taxis were.
segments.cn: 我下楼让他们出去，告诉他们出租车在哪里。

segments.en: And then I came up and I saw that the cat was gone.
segments.cn: 然后我上楼，发现猫不见了。

segments.en: And it turned out that the cat fell out of the window.
segments.cn: 结果发现猫从窗户掉了出去。

segments.en: All right, but our listeners have to know what story or what floor do you live on?
segments.cn: 好吧，但我们的听众得知道你住在哪个楼层？

segments.en: Yeah, so this is really dangerous, right?
segments.cn: 是的，这真的很危险，对吧？

segments.en: So I went outside and I was calling for my cat and I was like, Mr. Finn, where are you?
segments.cn: 所以我出去叫我的猫，我说，芬恩先生，你在哪里？

segments.en: How did you know he fell out?
segments.cn: 你怎么知道他掉了出去？

segments.en: And so he was calling back to me.
And so I picked him up and brought him to the house.
And we had to bring him to the vet.
segments.cn: 我们还得带他去看兽医。

segments.en: And it was 2.30 in the morning at this time.
And the vet was not very happy that we woke him up out of bed.
segments.cn: 兽医对我们把他从床上叫醒并不太高兴。

segments.en: But that was a really good emergency though.
segments.cn: 但这确实是个紧急情况。

segments.en: So anyway, we brought him to the vet.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，我们把他带到了兽医那里。

segments.en: He was in critical condition for a couple of days.
segments.cn: 他有几天处于危急状态。

segments.en: And then we had to keep him in the vet's ICU.
segments.cn: 然后我们不得不把他留在兽医的重症监护室。

segments.en: He broke two of his legs.
And so he was in the hospital for three weeks.
segments.cn: 所以他在医院待了三周。

segments.en: And then at home on bed rest for another three weeks.
segments.cn: 然后在家休息了另外三周。

segments.en: But now he's good as new.
He used up one of his seven lives.
segments.cn: 他用掉了七条命中的一条。

segments.en: I think maybe eight of his nine lives.
segments.cn: 我觉得他可能用掉了九条命中的八条。

segments.en: I guess that's the inspiration under this dialogue.
segments.cn: 我想这就是对话的灵感。

segments.en: Sometimes we Anglos really treat our cats and our hamsters and our dogs like they're our children.
segments.cn: 有时候我们这些英裔真的把猫、仓鼠和狗当作孩子一样对待。

segments.en: Well, I'm glad Mr. Finn is okay and he's walking and good as new.
segments.cn: 好吧，我很高兴芬恩先生没事，他能走动，恢复得很好。

segments.en: So maybe our users have some stories about their pets being taken to the hospital.
segments.cn: 所以也许我们的用户有一些关于他们宠物去医院的故事。

segments.en: I've never had a pet actually break a leg or anything.
segments.cn: 我从来没有宠物真的摔断过腿或什么的。

segments.en: So I don't have any pet stories this time.
segments.cn: 所以这次我没有任何宠物故事。

segments.en: But we want to hear what you think.
segments.cn: 但我们想听听你的想法。

segments.en: So come to EnglishPod.com, leave all your questions and comments and your stories.
segments.cn: 所以来EnglishPod.com，留下你的问题、评论和故事。

segments.en: And we'll be there to answer them.
Well guys, thanks for listening and until next time, goodbye.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，谢谢你们的收听，下次再见，拜拜。
